Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • coursework.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String file,
            int playerNumber)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets up the game

        Sets up the game using the parameters pass from the user. Creates a new board using the board file. Sets up a ArrayDeque for player for each of the players.

        Parameters:
        file - Board file
        playerNumber - Number of players in the game
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • moves

        private void moves(java.lang.String m)
        Takes a movement and executes it

        Receives a movement through an instance variable and does the corresponding move F = Forward B = Backward L = Left R = Right U = U-Turn W = Do nothing

        Parameters:
        m - Move

      • getRobotDetailstoString

      • excecuteMoves

        private void excecuteMoves()
        Calls the function to execute the move at the front of the ArrayDeque

        Goes through each player and then changes who the first player is by one. Does all 5 moves. Respawns any robots if they went off the board or into a pit during moving.

      • checkRobot

        protected void checkRobot(Robot r)
        Check if the robot is in the same space as an entity and check if it has won.

        Used when the board is activated. A robot is passed from activateBoard(). When the robot is checked it is tested against each possible Entity type it could be on. If it is on an Entity it calls the corresponding function. If the player Robot is on a Flag type Entity it will check what Flags have already been collected. Since a player needs to collect Flags in ascending order. It will only allow a Flag to be collected if the required Flags have been collected, it does this by checking the Flag array in the Robot class. The game over function is checked to see if it is Null. If it isn't null, meaning the game has been won, it opens a new GUI scene saying "Game Over". The player details is updated to the player who has won. Closing this scene closes the entire game.

        Parameters:
        r - Robot

      • removeLastMove

        public void removeLastMove()
        Remove the last chosen move

      • checkGameOver

        private Robot checkGameOver()
        Tests each player Robot to see if it has collected all the Flags
        Returns:
        r Robot

      • activateBoard

        private void activateBoard()
        Activates the board

        Goes through the board and checks each robot from top left to bottom right.
